8.1.17  5:01 am   hey bill. i have a predicament. school will be starting very soon and i have some things i would like to get done before i decended back into hell, namely one very important Thing. i am very excited to be working on the Thing, but the problem is many others around me are aware of me working on the Thing, and this troubles me, because they are breathing down my neck and asking me to be done with the Thing. this makes me rush, and then become unsatisfied with what i have done, causing me to delete what I have done and restart, not only ultimately wasting my time, but makes the others unhappy and ask more frequently. how do i stop this cycle?

8.1.17  12:27 am   Do you think there's a point at which you need to isolate yourself just a little bit from the fanbase in order to focus?

     Like not a whole lot but enough to bring more balance.
Some fans will see you give an inch to someone else and demand a mile.

8.1.17  12:18 am   You seem quite annoyed by people nagging you about updating all your pages and them not even realizing that you do update them. Why don't you just ignore them and work on whatever you want? Do you feel that much of a need to please these people that it detracts from your own want to work on certain things?

7.31.17  4:16 pm   what's your honest opinion on the whole "art is subjective" debate? i find myself changing opinion on that every once in a while, especially about music and film (which i know more about than painting or sculpture). of course, everyone can like what they like but i can't help but give more weight to experts like critics and other artists. for example, an average movie goer may like some film that Roger Ebert says is crap, and that's ok, but without watching the film i'm gonna believe Roger Ebert first. if Bill Wurtz (a multi instrumentalist with years of music behind his belt) says that  some piece is bad then that opinion holds more weight than if i said that. and even more so when you have a majority of experts agree with it. this has lead to a lot of dissonance where i feel ashamed when i like something, or even more ashamed when i dislike something that for example quentin tarantino says is a masterpiece. I just can't help but feel that an expe rts opinion even on art is more important than an average consumers opinion. Your thoughts?
